item.title: Brooke Burke, 46, glows in one-shoulder top as she talks fitness at Build Series in NYC
item.description: Brooke Burke had her eyes on the future as she appeared on Build Series to discuss her Summer Slim Down Challenge. The model turned fitness guru wore a red top the showed off her toned physique.
item.content:encoded:
She filed for divorce from her husband David Charvet back in April.

But Brooke Burke had her eyes on the future as she appeared on Build Series to discuss her Summer Slim Down Challenge.

The 46-year-old model turned fitness guru wore a fitted, one-shoulder red top the showed off her toned physique.

Scroll down for video 

Brooke's exposed arm looked toned as it glistened under the studio lights.

She tucked her candy red garment into hot pink pants that added an extra touch of summer fun to the vibrant ensemble.

Donning black, open-toe heels the former Dancing With the Stars co-host couldn't stop smiling as she made her way onto the interview show.

Pulling her brown tresses into a leisurely ponytail, she painted her lips with a glossy pink lipstick.

The former Playboy model turned up to the Build Series to discuss her Brooke Burke Body app and her upcoming Summer Slim Down Challenge.

She also talked about growing up as a tomboy and how she got her start in fitness.

Earlier in the day, Burke appeared on Good Morning America to share with viewers a few of her top workout moves to tone and sculpt the body for summer.

'As busy as we are, we still need to tap into self care and take care of our bodies,' the model said on the morning show. 'Carve out the time and figure out how you can do it at home because time is our biggest excuse.

'I've got this app. You can do it on the road, you can do it on vacation, and you don't even need WiFi. It's effective and short and sweet and specific.'

The app costs a mere eight dollars a month to watch Burke's step-by-step workout videos.

In April, Burke filed for divorce from David Charvet after seven years of marriage.

The couple has two children together, Heaven and Shaya.

She has also has two daughters, Neriah and Sierra, from her previous marriage to Garth Fisher.

item.title: Ariana Grande Pete Davidson engaged: Social media reactions
item.description: Ariana Grande and Pete Davidson are reportedly engaged after just a few weeks of officially dating. Not surprisingly, Twitter reacted very quickly and strongly to the news of the couple's engagement.
item.content:encoded:
Singer Ariana Grande and SNL star Pete Davidson are reportedly tying the knot after just a few weeks of dating.

Us Weekly broke the news after they confirmed  the two were a couple on May 21, 2018.

According to one source: ‘They are a perfect fit. They are not rushing to get married but are really in love. Their friends are really excited and supportive.’

The couple are thought to not be rushing headlong into things anytime soon however, with one insider stating: ‘They are looking forward to a very long engagement together.’

Not too surprisingly, Twitter and other social media platforms lit up as soon as the news broke: 

Ariana Grande and Pete Davidson went from casually dating to tattoos to engaged faster than I make the decision to actually like someone.

— gabrielle 💋 (@gabalexa) June 11, 2018

The literal definition of “I can’t even” is Pete Davidson and Ariana Grande getting engaged after 2 weeks

— Kasandra (@Kasandraa_Rose) June 11, 2018

WHOSE MURDER ARE PETE DAVIDSON AND ARIANA GRANDE TRYING TO DISTRACT US FROM

— ellie poole (@shadethrower666) June 11, 2018

news articles: pete davidson and ariana grande are engaged.

us: pic.twitter.com/Izea5JOYhT

— ㅤㅤْ (@tearfeltari) June 11, 2018

Me finding out about Ariana grande and Pete Davidson getting engaged... pic.twitter.com/t48Sw9HXGD

— Dead PineApool (@commoncrazy22) June 11, 2018

i have had colds that have lasted longer than ariana grande and pete davidson have been together https://t.co/Z4hytdqZzD

— Tanya Ghahremani (@tanyaghahremani) June 11, 2018

How I feel after hearing that Ariana Grande & Pete Davidson are engaged even though they only dated for few weeks. pic.twitter.com/okdRfjb0CI

— 🌟데리러 가🌟 (@EunmiLovesU) June 11, 2018

Who is Pete Davidson?

Pete Davidson is an actor and comedian. 

Born on November 16, 1993 in New York City, he got his start in show business in 2013 after appearing on the MTV show Failosophy while also making standup appearances on shows like Jimmy Kimmel Live! and Comedy Underground with Dave Attell. 

He later appeared on the hit TV show Brooklyn Nine-Nine and rose to fame after being a regular cast member of Saturday Night Live since 2014.
item.dc:abstract: Singer Ariana Grande and comedian Pete Davidson are reportedly engaged after just a few weeks of officially dating, according to several breaking news reports. Us Weekly broke the news after confirming the two were dating back on May 21, 2018. Not surprisingly, Twitter reacted very quickly and strongly to the news of the couple's engagement.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Quigley
item.mi:shortTitle: Ariana Grande Pete Davidson engaged: Social media reactions

item.title: Keeping Up With The Kardashians Season 15: All you need to know
item.description: Keeping Up With The Kardashians is due to return to E! for its 15th season this summer. A trailer for the upcoming season teases plenty of family drama to come and a lot of laughs, too.
item.content:encoded:
Keeping Up With The Kardashians will return to E! for a 15th season.

The network released a trailer for the latest installment, which teased drama, laughs and the long-awaited return of Kylie Jenner on the reality series.

The short clip appears to show Kourtney Kardashian and Kendall Jenner having a serious conversation, Khloe Kardashian's growing baby bump, a Kanye West sighting and either baby Stormi Webster or True Thompson's Keeping Up With The Kardashian's debut.

Kylie, who was featured in season 14 almost exclusively via phone calls from her mother, Kris Jenner, and siblings, appeared briefly in the preview holding a baby.

What do you need to know before the drama kicks off on E!? Here's the scoop.

Keeping Up With The Kardashians Season 15 

Keeping Up With The Kardashians Season 15 has been announced. E! released the first glimpse at what's to come in the new season, which appears to emphasize the strong bond between the Kardashian-Jenner siblings.

The trailer opens with Kim Kardashian saying: 'There's, like, nothing better when it's, like, all of us together.'

Welcome to the good life...

A post shared by Kim Kardashian West (@kimkardashian) on Jun 9, 2018 at 6:50am PDT

It's followed by a series of tense confrontations between the siblings, tender moments and the debut of a new member of the Kardashian-Jenner clan.

As the Keeping Up With The Kardashians trailer ends, Kris Jenner says in a voice over: 'Sooner or later you guys are gonna realize how much you all mean to one another.'

Keeping Up With The Kardashians Season 15 trailer

E! released the first look at Keeping Up With The Kardashians Season 15 on June 8, 2018. The trailer teases a tense sit down between Kourtney Kardashian and Kendall Jenner, a rift growing between Kourtney and Khloe Kardashian and so much more. 

Check out the nearly three minute video below. 

A lot has changed for your fav fam. Get a glimpse behind the headlines when #KUWTK returns this summer, only on E! pic.twitter.com/ZuQrQwc5On

— Kardashians on E! (@KUWTK) June 8, 2018

KUWTK Season 15 premiere date

E! Hasn't yet announced a premiere date for Keeping Up With The Kardashians Season 15. The trailer reveals that the show is due to come back during summer 2018, but nothing much else.

When does Keeping Up With The Kardashians air?

Typically, Keeping Up With The Kardashians is on every Sunday. It seems likely that the show will keep that same slot. 

What channel is Keeping Up With The Kardashians on? 

Keeping Up With The Kardashians is on E! 

This channel varies based on what provider you have. It's channel 114 on DISH Network, channel 236 on Direct TV, channel 51 on optimum and channel 696 on Verizon FiOS.

Our little girl, True Thompson, has completely stolen our hearts and we are overwhelmed with LOVE. Such a blessing to welcome this angel into the family! Mommy and Daddy loooooove you True! pic.twitter.com/Hn2RFzRMuu

— Khloé (@khloekardashian) April 16, 2018
item.dc:abstract: Keeping Up With The Kardashians is due to return to E! for its 15th season this summer. A trailer for the upcoming season teases plenty of family drama to come and a lot of laughs, too. There's plenty to be excited about in the short teaser clip, but the most exciting thing just may be Kylie Jenner's return to the series. The youngest of the Kardashian-Jenner family is seen in the season 15 trailer holding what appears to be her daughter, baby Stormi. E! hasn't yet announced an official return date for Keeping Up With The Kardashians.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Quigley
item.mi:shortTitle: Keeping Up With The Kardashians Season 15: All you need to know

item.title: Sienna Miller exhibits her off-duty style in a form-fitting top and flare culottes as she joins male pal for cosy lunch in New York
item.description: The 36-year-old actress lived up to her style savvy ways as she enjoyed a low-key lunch date with a male pal at Italian eatery Bar Pitti in New York City on Monday afternoon.
item.content:encoded:
She's no stranger to displaying her incredibly chic ensembles on camera and at high-profile events.

And Sienna Miller lived up to her style savvy ways as she enjoyed a low-key lunch date with a male pal at Italian eatery Bar Pitti in New York City on Monday afternoon.

The 36-year-old actress looked every inch the fashion maven as she donned a pair of elaborate flare culottes, paired with a trendy tan belt.

The Alfie star continued her fashionable display as she accentuated her slender frame in a figure-hugging turtleneck top, tied in with comfy black loafers.

Adding touches of pazzazz into her ensemble, the blonde beauty wore a pair of cat-eye sunglasses and toted a bright red handbag for a splash of colour.

Sienna showcased her glowing complexion with light hints of make-up, and styled her glossy tresses into an effortlessly chic braid. 

The mother-of-one appeared in high spirits during her outing with her friend, as she put on an animated display while tucking into her meal. 

Her pal opted for a casual appearance as he was clad in indigo jeans, a crisp shirt and a slightly-distressed bomber jacket.

The American Sniper star recently spoke about her style has evolved now she is in her thirties, and explained her fashion sense has become far more mellow. 

Sienna told Harper's Bazaar: 'I never used to mind drawing attention to myself through what I wore...'

She added: 'I didn't mind being quite brave and colourful and I don't want that anymore. The mini-skirts and stuff…'

'It was great and I was in my twenties, but I've grown up a little bit. I love classic fashion; for now, I'm in a toned down, mellow state.' 

Sienna relocated to New York years ago with her five-year-old daughter Marlowe, but she is also regularly seen in the city with ex-fiancé Tom Sturridge - Marlowe's father.

She is so settled that her five-bedroom townhouse in London's Queen’s Park was recently put up for both sale and rent. 

According to The Times, Sienna bought the home in 2014 for £3million but put it on the market for sale at £2.75m.

item.title: Kylie Jenner has been getting 'kidnap threats' and that's why she won't show more photos of Stormi
item.description: The 20-year-old Keeping Up With The Kardashian's star 'is terrified - she’s stepping up security,' an insider revealed on Monday, saying she has been plagued by vile abuse on social media.
item.content:encoded:
She's been plagued by vile abuse on social media since giving birth to daughter Stormi with rapper boyfriend Travis Scott back in February.

And on Monday Kylie Jenner made the decision to delete almost all the photos of the tot from social media.

The 20-year-old Keeping Up With The Kardashian's star did this because she 'is terrified - she’s stepping up security' after having received 'kidnap threats,' an insider told The Sun on Monday. 

'She hardly takes Stormi out in public but is now making sure that she's got protection at all times,' the insider said.

The source continued: 'There have been an increasing number of trolls on social media calling Stormi ugly, and throwing out really horrible insults.

'It’s been really upsetting for Kylie, because some of the comments are direct threats to kidnap her.'  

Kylie has been sharing the journey of motherhood with her 109 million Instagram followers since her daughter's birth in February.   

She took to social media on Sunday to reveal that she wouldn't be sharing any more photos of Stormi 'right now' after she was slammed for cutting out her baby from an image. 

'i spy with my little eye...' she captioned a sweet makeup-free photo that saw Stormi's head just peaking through. 

And it wasn't long before fans accused her of cropping out her baby - leading Kylie to hit back.  

'Yeah i cut my baby out. I'm not sharing photos of my girl right now,' replied the beauty mogul.  

She then went a step further - deleting all snaps that showed her daughter's face after receiving the alleged 'kidnap threats.'

The first of three photos to be saved was on February 6 when she revealed that not only had she been pregnant for the past nine months, but also that she had given birth. 'Stormi webster,' she captioned the snap. 

And although two more photos referenced the child, her face was hidden in each.

It's not the first time Kylie's taken herself out of the spotlight.

The youngest Jenner sister also kept her pregnancy under wraps, revealing after the birth that she wanted to 'prepare for this role of a lifetime in the most positive, stress free, and healthy way I knew how.'

'I understand you’re used to me bringing you along on all my journeys. my pregnancy was one I chose not to do in front of the world,' she wrote at the time. 

'I knew for myself I needed to prepare for this role of a lifetime in the most positive, stress free, and healthy way I knew how. There was no gotcha moment, no big paid reveal I had planned. 

'I knew my baby would feel every stress and every emotion so I chose to do it this way for my little life and our happiness.' 

Back in 2015, Kylie told ElleUK: ‘Once I have a kid I’m not going to be on Instagram. You know, I’ll probably delete my Instagram and just… I don’t know, live life.’
item.dc:abstract: She's been plagued by vile abuse on social media since giving birth to daughter Stormi with rapper boyfriend Travis Scott back in February. And on Monday Kylie Jenner made the decision to delete all the photos of the tot from social media after receiving horrifying kidnap threats. The 20-year-old 'is terrified - she’s stepping up security,' an insider told The Sun on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Heidi Parker
item.mi:shortTitle: Kylie Jenner deletes photos of Stormi after online 'kidnap threats'

item.title: Danielle Lloyd covers her figure in white crochet dress for a stroll down Ocean Drive in Miami with fiancé Michael O'Neill amid pregnancy rumours
item.description: Danielle Lloyd, 34, has been leaving fans guessing about her pregnancy and was seen enjoying her holiday in Miami with fiancé Michael O'Neill on Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
There have been rumours swirling of her pregnancy for the past couple of weeks.

But Danielle Lloyd, 34, has been leaving fans guessing, and was seen enjoying her holiday in Miami with fiancé Michael O'Neill on Sunday.

The reality star looked the picture of happiness, as she donned a white crochet dress with tassle detailing to highlight her holiday tan.

The mother-of-four pulled back her caramel tresses with a clip as she strolled down Ocean drive, clutching two roses.

Michael similarly looked the picture of happiness, wearing neon green swim shorts with a simple white shirt to show off his golden hue. 

The outing comes after she sparked pregnancy speculation when she was pictured caressing her stomach on holiday with Michael.

The rumours are swirling less than nine months after Danielle gave birth to her fourth son Ronnie, her first child with Michael.

She also shares sons Archie, seven, Harry, six, and George, three, with her ex-husband Jamie O'Hara.

However, she has made no secret of the fact that she wants to have a little girl and revealed she will use gender selection to ensure her next child is a daughter.

A representative for Danielle declined to comment when approached by MailOnline.

Danielle is no doubt glad to be on a relaxing holiday after she was targeted by hackers, who released nude images and an explicit video online that they took from her icloud account.

The Big Brother star has been a victim of hacking in the past, with images circulating online last year when she was pregnant with son Ronnie.

After Danielle was mocked by trolls over the new images, Danielle hit out at the people who found the shocking breach of her privacy 'funny' and the 'scumbags' who had targeted her.

She tweeted: 'Yes my I cloud has again been hacked by some scum bag this is now in the hands of my lawyers again!

'I won’t be made to feel embarrassed but thankful the website has been taken down already. Anyone finding this funny well shame on you! your personal stuff should be safe @Apple [sic]'
item.dc:abstract: There have been rumours swirling of her pregnancy for the past couple of weeks. But Danielle Lloyd, 34, has been leaving fans guessing, and was seen enjoying her holiday in Miami with fiancé Michael O'Neill on Sunday. The reality star looked the picture of happiness, as she donned a white crochet dress with tassle detailing to highlight her holiday tan.

item.title: Ben Affleck dresses down in a bomber jacket and baseball cap as he spends the day with his mom
item.description: The 45-year-old Batman star, who was engrossed in a phone call, was spotted wearing a navy bomber jacket, khaki pants, and a baseball cap.
item.content:encoded:
He's a busy Hollywood actor.

But Ben Affleck always has time for his mom. On Monday the 45-year-old Batman star stepped out in Los Angeles with his mother, Christine.

Affleck, who was engrossed in a phone call, was spotted wearing a navy bomber jacket, khaki pants, and a baseball cap.

Christine walked alongside him as they strolled in the street near his new Brentwood home.

The Pearl Harbor star recently purchased a $19.2 million dollar home less than a mile from ex-wife Jennifer Garner's current digs in the ritzy Los Angeles neighborhood.

Affleck shares three children—Violet, Seraphina, nine, and Samuel, age six—with his ex.

The couple split back in 2015 and Ben is currently dating SNL producer Lindsay Shookus.

As well as purchasing his new bachelor pad, Affleck also put his 87-acre Georgia compound on the market. The house is currently listed at $8.9 million. 

'Everyone has a good relationship,' a source told E! News of Ben and Jen. 'They are adults who are co-parenting. He was looking for a long time and really wanted to find the right house for his family.' 

It's been roughly two weeks since Ben returned from filming in Hawaii.

Set to premiere in 2019, Triple Frontier stars Affleck and Charlie Hunnam. 

The story follows five friends as they attempt to take down a South American drug lord.
item.dc:abstract: He's a busy Hollywood actor. On Monday, Ben Affleck stepped out in Los Angeles with his mom Christine. The 45-year-old Batman star, who was engrossed in a phone call, was spotted wearing a navy bomber jacket, khaki pants, and a baseball cap.

item.title: Who is model Jordan Kimball? Bachelorette 2018 villain revealed
item.description: Jordan Kimball has stirred the pot on The Bachelorette since he entered the mansion. The male model is due to be confronted about his bad behavior in an upcoming episode of the ABC show.
item.content:encoded:
Jordan Kimball is making a name for himself on season 14 of The Bachelorette for all the wrong reasons.

The 26-year-old male model is being called the villain of the season after he stirred the pot in the premiere and subsequent episode. The tables will reportedly turn in episode three, though, and Jordan will be the one under fire.

If you're not familiar with the Florida native, who called himself the 'Pensive Gentleman', it's time to get to know him.

Here's the scoop. 

Who is Jordan Kimball? 

Jordan Kimball is a model from Crystal River, Florida. According to his modelling profile, Jordan is 6-feet tall.

He's done work for companies like Quay Australia sunglasses, Boarding Pass NYC, and was featured on John Craig's Fall/Winter 2017 cover. 

Jordan also modeled for a wedding planning company called Lavish Designs and Events. 

Jordan week 1: " lt's a cocktail party, why aren't you wearing socks?"
Jordan week 2: *walks around at the cocktail party with just underwear on*#TheBachelorette

— Jenn Cammel (@Jenn_Camm_) June 5, 2018

While he may not know that 'ingenuinetitty' isn't  a word, Jordan is well educated. He attended the College of Central Florida with a business specialist degree. 

Jordan Kimball Wilhelmina

Jordan Kimball is, in fact, signed to Wihelmina models. He has a profile on the site that includes samples of some of his work. You can find it here.

Jordan Kimball Instagram

Jordan Kimball's Instagram, which can be found here, is largely his modelling shots. He does occasionally post a photo of him from an outing or vacation. It also appears that he may do some sponsored content for brands.  

Thanks @johncraigclothier @currentbyjohncraig @blairdelongysanchez @strongsuitclothing @roberttalbott @magnannishoes @robertgrahamnyc for the assembly of my first impression suit. Best of brands and best of professionals @johncraigclothier so much love for you all. The journey for love continues.

A post shared by Jordan Kimball (@jordan__kimball) on May 29, 2018 at 7:59pm PDT

When is The Bachelorette on?

The Bachelorette is on Monday nights at 8pm ET on ABC. 

The Bachelorette Season 14, episode 3

During the 3rd episode of the 2018 season of The Bachelorette, Jordan Kimball will come under fire during a post-group date cocktail party. 

A preview for the episode shows he and co-star David Ravitz having a tense conversation about Jordan's intentions on the show.

In case you forgot, Jordan the model takes his image VERY SERIOUSLY. #TheBachelorette pic.twitter.com/PgBb8fdM6t

— The Bachelorette (@BacheloretteABC) June 10, 2018

David suggests that Jordan may be there to further his modelling career. He also mentions Jordan bragging about racking up thousands of swipes on the mobile dating app, Tinder. 

Jordan appears to deny the claims, but only time will tell how Becca reacts to this kind of drama. 

Say what you want, read what they say... but my heart is pure, my intentions are lined with gold.

A post shared by Jordan Kimball (@jordan__kimball) on May 18, 2018 at 5:00pm PDT
item.dc:abstract: Jordan Kimball has stirred the pot on The Bachelorette since he entered the mansion. The male model is due to be confronted about his bad behavior in an upcoming episode of the ABC show. Another suitor will question Jordan's motives for being on The Bachelorette during season 14, episode three. It's unclear how long Jordan will get to stick around on The Bachelorette, so let's enjoy his one-of-a kind villainy while we can. Here's what you need to know about him.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Quigley
item.mi:shortTitle: Who is model Jordan Kimball? Bachelorette 2018 villain revealed

item.title: Honey Boo Boo, 12, is almost as tall as her mother Mama June, 38, as they plug From Not To Hot in NYC
item.description: Mama June and her daughter Honey Boo Boo had a fun day in NYC on Monday. The From Not To Hot stars - who are also mother and daughter - were all done up for press appearances.
item.content:encoded:
Mama June, 38, and her daughter Honey Boo Boo, 12, had a fun day in NYC on Monday.

The stars - who are also mother and daughter - were all done up for press appearances. One of them was at the Build Series. They are on appearing on season two of their hit TV show From Not To Hot, which saw June lose over 300lbs thanks to gastric bypass surgery.

In one snap taken on the street, the two looked to be about the same height. Mama June is 5ft4in and Honey appears to be just over 5ft. 

Scroll down for video 

June looked slender in a white top with matching sneakers as well as black leggings and a cute purple purse with a floral print.

Her little one had on a black top and leggings. Her hair and makeup were nicely glammed.

They have been inseparable since becoming famous on Here Comes Honey Boo Boo in 2012.

This comes after their show debuted last week.

Mama June was ready to show off her new figure as she donned lingerie for a photo shoot in the season premiere of her show From Not To Hot.

In the episode aired Friday, the 38-year-old stunner gave her best supermodel impression laying on a couch in black and white underwear.

Daring to impress, the blonde bombshell revealed her ample cleavage as the bra barely covered her chest.

Her gorgeous gams were thrust on center stage as the bikini bottoms rode high on her perfectly proportioned hips.

A scintillating peek at her pert derriere was had as she rested on her stomach and arched her back.

This season also teams June with her daughter Honey Boo Boo for a mother daughter beauty pageant.

And it's revealed that June has gained some of her weight back as she went from a size 4 back to a size 12 which causes problems for her fitting into pageant garb.

An unknown contestant in the pageant is shown looking at June from afar and stating: 'The pageant is classy... she is trashy.'

Meanwhile, June's daughter Pumpkin was surprised by her baby's daddy Josh as he proposes to her.

Holding their baby up in front of Pumpkin, Josh read the t-shirt the baby is wearing which reads Mommy Will You Marry My Daddy?.

And at the Vegas wedding of Pumpkin and Josh, June discussed her plans for her boyfrined Geno with her sister Joanne.

'Geno is the one. And I'm gonna put a ring on it,' she said.

At the ceremony, June stood up and announced: 'I want to get married.'

This comes after a scene where Geno said to Josh: ''I'm never getting married again.'

They are on season two of their hit show which saw June lost over 300lbs thanks to gastric bypass surgery.

item.title: Elsa Hosk flashes her taut midriff in cropped oversized jacket as she heads out in New York
item.description: She rose to the position of Victoria's Secret Angel in 2015. And Elsa Hosk cemented her supermodel credentials when she was glimpsed hitting the cobblestones in New York City on Thursday.
item.content:encoded:
She rose to the position of Victoria's Secret Angel in 2015.

And Elsa Hosk cemented her supermodel credentials when she was glimpsed hitting the cobblestones in New York City on Thursday. 

The Stockholm-born 29-year-old bared her enviably chiseled midriff beneath a canary yellow cropped jacket, leaving all but one of its buttons undone.

Her loose-fitted oversized top served all the better to highlight her slim waist, clad in leggings.

Sweeping her platinum blonde hair back into a bun, she shielded her eyes from the rays with cat-eye sunglasses and slipped on a pair of Nikes.

The internationally famous model, who used to play professional basketball in her home country, carried a plastic lidded cup of green juice.

Elsa first walked the Victoria's Secret Fashion Show in 2011 when it was held in New York City, and she was garlanded as an Angel four years later.

She was one of the cavalcade of models who trod the runway at last November's Victoria's Secret Fashion Show, which was thrown in Shanghai - the first time the annual event has ever been held in Asia.

Last year, Marie Claire posted an interview Elsa gave them, offering some hints as to how she has maintained that exquisite figure of hers.

Where exercise is concerned, 'I love boxing, and I try to mix it up as much as I can. Boxing makes you kind of tight, so it's really good to mix that with barre, pilates, or something that'll stretch you out and make you longer.'

Elsa has confessed that, 'I'm not the person that loves to be in the gym so much,' explaining that 'I like to mix it up as much as possible, otherwise I'll get bored.'

Her area of concentration, when it comes to honing her physique, is 'the butt for sure. It's just always on display. And it's a vicious circle because if you start working your butt out a lot and then you stop it, it goes like [makes a deflating motion with her hands]…you have to keep it up.'

item.title: Mel Gibson, 62, looks casually cool in jeans and sneakers as he goes on a pizza run in Malibu
item.description: Mel Gibson, 62, was spotted out and about near his Malibu home Monday while on his way to get a pizza. The star was dressed casually in jeans, a blue shirt and black sneakers.
item.content:encoded:
He might be a celebrity, but Mel Gibson isn't above playing delivery man.

The 62-year-old actor was spotted out and about near his home in Malibu Monday while on his way to get a delicious pie.  

The Mad Max star was dressed casually in jeans, a blue shirt and black sneakers. 

The Academy Award winner has been quite the busy man.

He's signed on to direct a drama called The Destroyer, which is centered on the Battle of Okinawa which took place in 1945.

 It has been reported that Mark Wahlberg, 47, is slated to star in the new Gibson's World War II drama.

The Courier Mail claimed on Tuesday that the Hollywood heavyweight let slip he's attached to the project, which is set to be filmed in Queensland.

The film's script has reportedly been penned by Rosalind Ross, who is Mel's partner of four years and mother of his ninth child, one-year-old son, Lars.

The big screen epic could follow in the footsteps of the Gibson-directed war drama Hacksaw Ridge, which won two Academy Awards.

Boogie Nights star Mark and Lethal Weapon leading man Mel are good mates, who worked together on the comedy Daddy's Home 2 in 2017.

The Braveheart actor recently made a mystery trip to Australia which was later revealed to be a location scouting tour.

The actor's ties to Australia include him having moved to Australia at 12-years-old, and having studied at the prestigious National Institute of Dramatic Art.
item.dc:abstract: Mel Gibson, 62, was spotted out and about near his Malibu home Monday while on his way to get a pizza. The star was dressed casually in jeans, a blue shirt and black sneakers.

item.title: Ariana Grande and SNL star Pete Davidson 'are engaged' after only a few weeks of dating
item.description: Ariana Grande and Pete Davidson are engaged The report comes from Us Weekly on Monday. The two have been dating for only a 'few weeks.'
item.content:encoded:
Ariana Grande and Pete Davidson are celebrating their engagement, according to multiple reports. 

The two 'were telling people that they're engaged' at Robert Pattinson's birthday party in Los Angeles on Saturday, UsWeekly revealed.

And TMZ added that 24-year-old SNL funnyman popped the question 'last week.' 

The two started dating about a month ago. Bang Bang singer Ariana, 24, had only just broken up with rapper Mac Miller in April, while Davidson split from his long-time love in May.

'They are a perfect fit. They are not rushing to get married,' one insider said. 'Their friends are really excited and supportive.'

'They are both constantly making each other laugh,' the Us Weekly's first source added.

'Their moms have met. They've been very public with their relationship on social media, and they are very in love.' 

A third source said, 'They are looking forward to a very long engagement together.'

Grande's rep has yet to return calls to DailyMail.com for comment.

People magazine also had sources confirming they were set to wed, with one saying Ariana's ring was 'big'.

'It’s a recent engagement,' a source told the site.

'They’re just two people who found love quickly and make each other happy all the time. They both started talking about it this past weekend. It’s nothing they’ve been hiding.' 

Ariana has been posting on Twitter since the couple's news hit the web and her notes seem to express her joy about being newly engaged.

In one Tweet she wrote, 'Tell them how I'm defying gravity,' which is a line from Wicked; Ariana is rumored to be starring in an upcoming production of the musical.

She quickly followed that with a post that said, 'I love you (14 see-no-evil monkey emoji) sm  (24 see-no-evil monkey emoji) ok bye.'

The couple were seen together at a birthday party on Sunday in images shared to social media.

They were first reported to be dating in late May.

Several days later they became Instagram official with a cute Harry Potter post. 

Davidson has also gotten two tattoos that are a nod to the siren. Sitting just behind and below the comic's left ear, one piece of ink featured a mask with bunny ears symbol that has become synonymous with the Bang Bang singer.

The second tattoo was needled onto his thumb and simply featured the letters A and G, which likely has something to do with Ariana. 

Davidson, who lost his father in the 9/11 attacks, suffers from Borderline Personality Disorder, but has defended his relationship with Ariana.

'I been hearing a lot of "people with bpd can’t be in relationships" talk,' he wrote on Instagram. 'I just wanna let you know that’s not true. Just because someone has a mental illness does not mean they can’t be happy and in a relationship.' 

Ariana had been dating Miller for two years before she announced the end of the relationship on May 10 via a post to Instagram.

She wrote, 'Hi! This is one of my best friends in the whole world and favourite people on the planet Malcolm McCormick. 

'I respect and adore him endlessly and am grateful to have him in my life in any form, at all times regardless of how our relationship changes or what the universe holds for each of us!I can't wait to know and support you forever and I'm so proud of you!!'

Davidson previously dated Larry David's daughter Cazzie, and only confirmed the end of their two-year relationship on May 16. 

As news of the engagement broke, Cazzie posted a selfie of herself drinking a large glass of red wine, and happily winking at the camera.

Davidson and Ariana share more than just show business success - both young artists have dealt with terrorism-related tragedy in their lives. 

Twenty-three people were killed and more than 800 hurt in May 2017 during Ariana's show at Manchester, England's Manchester Arena following an attack by a suicide bomber.

Meanwhile Davidson was seven-years-old when he lost his firefighter father Scott during the September 11, 2001 attacks on the World Trade Center.

His mother, Amy, has talked of his total devastation at the loss, which affected him profoundly throughout his childhood.

She told the New York Times in 2015: ‘It’s sad how sad he was growing up.’

On one occasion, Davidson ended up ripping out all of his hair until he was bald. Amy noted that comedy, which Davidson started at the age of 16, was what made him ‘really, really happy’.

His rise through the comedy circuit was stratospheric, and he was just 20 when in 2014 he joined the SNL cast. 

Also on Monday, Ariana and Nicki Minaj announced a new song together.
item.dc:abstract: Ariana Grande and Pete Davidson are engaged. The report comes from Us Weekly on Monday. The two have been dating for only a 'few weeks.' She broke up with rapper Mac Miller on a few months ago. 'They are a perfect fit. They are not rushing to get married,' one insider said. 'Their friends are really excited and supportive.' A second source added: they 'were telling people that they’re engaged' at Robert Pattinson’s birthday party in Los Angeles on Saturday.

item.title: Dirty Den actor gravely ill: Ex-EastEnders villain Leslie Grantham, 71, is fighting for his life in hospital with friends fearing the worst
item.description: Grantham has returned to the UK from Bulgaria where he has been living for a number of years to be under the care of doctors. The legendary actor has received secret visits from his close pals.
item.content:encoded:
Former EastEnders arch villain Leslie Grantham is said to be fighting for his life today.

The actor, 71, who played 'Dirty' Den Watts on the BBC soap for years, is gravely ill.

'Very poorly' Grantham has returned to the UK from Bulgaria where he has been living for a number of years to be closely monitored by doctors.  

A friend told The Sun: 'Leslie is being looked after. Those who are close to him are hugely worried and are praying for his well-being.'  

He moved abroad following the breakdown of his marriage after 31 years.

The star looked frail when he was last seen in February filming for The Krays: Dead Man Walking, which is set for release in December.

Fans have been wishing him well today and said they are praying for his recovery. 

Ben Ofoedu, the singer from Phats and Small, said today: 'Producer of the panto I was in. A train journey with him was one of most fascinating journeys I had. Full of knowledge praying all will be well. @LesGranthamReal'.  

Des Atkinson tweeted: @LesGranthamReal sorry to hear you are ill hope you hope you feel well soon #legend'.

Leslie played the Queen Vic landlord 'Dirty' Den from 1985 to 1989. 

He helped the soap pull in its biggest-ever audience, when more than 30 million viewers tuned in to see him hand over divorce papers to lying wife Angie on Christmas Day 1986.  

It is still the fourth most watched TV show in British history, narrowly beaten by Princess Diana's funeral and the 1966 World Cup final.

Den earned his 'Dirty' nickname in the programme after beating up his wife and impregnating a 16-year-old girl before he was apparently killed off in 1989.

In 2003, however, Den was given a rather dubious resurrection when it was revealed that he had survived the assassination attempt and fled to Spain.

Once back in Walford, Den quickly returned to his villainous ways, spreading mayhem for another two years until new wife Chrissie battered him over the head with an iron doorstop. 

She killed him off for good in the very pub he once owned and buried him in the cellar of the Queen Vic in an episode aired in 2005. It was viewed by 16.2 million people. 

Top 5 biggest moments in UK television history 

1. The 1966 World Cup Final, 30 July 1966: 32.30 million viewers

2. Diana's funeral, 6 September 1997: 32.10 million viewers

3. The Royal Family documentary, 21 June 1969 and 28 June 1969: 30.69 million viewers

4. EastEnders (Den handing Angie divorce papers), 25 December 1986: 30.15 million viewers

5. Apollo 13's splashdown, 17 April 1970: 28.60 million viewers  

Grantham enlisted in the British Army in 1965, being sent to West Germany with the Royal Fusiliers.

In 1966, however, he was involved in a struggle with a taxi driver he was attempting to rob in Osnabruck, Lower Saxony.

The driver, Felix Reese, was ultimately shot in the head and died. 

In 1967, Grantham was convicted of murder and sentenced to life imprisonment. 

It was during his time behind bars - he spent ten years in British jails - that he first took to acting.

He performed in many plays during his time in prison and was encouraged to pursue acting by Labour politician T Dan Smith and actress Louise Jameson.

In 2004, Grantham was exposed by a Sunday newspaper after he took part in webcam chats while masturbating and sucking his finger in his dressing room.

He apologised to his family for the embarrassment but later said he was 'set up'.   

Grantham said he was so devastated after the scandal that he attempted suicide. 

After failing in all his attempts, he explained: 'I accepted that even at suicide I was c***.'

After leaving EastEnders, Grantham played the pantomime villain in various productions.

He also featured in two UK tours of Beyond Reasonable Doubt, a stage adaption of a Jeffrey Archer play.  

In 2006, he played Jimmy Collins - a man on the run from prison - in The Bill.  

He most recently appeared in The English Neighbour, a Bulgarian TV series based on a book of the same name.   

He revealed in 2015 that he would like to win a role in Coronation Street.

Despite becoming infamous as one of Walford's most notorious residents, he confessed he had been offered a role in the ITV soap before he ever starred in EastEnders, but turned it down.

But the actor admitted that his EastEnders fame might make it hard for audiences to accept him in another soap role.

'It's difficult to get in now if you are well-known in another soap,' he said. 'I know Michelle Collins went into Corrie but I'll always be known as Dirty Den.'

In 2016, he told The Mirror that he had made some 'quite catastrophic' diversions during his life. 

He added: 'But I'm safe in the knowledge that what I do now is good.

'Of course I have regrets, but you can't go round wearing a hair shirt all your life, otherwise you'll never get out of bed in the morning. I f***** up, now I'm going to move on.'
item.dc:abstract: Former EastEnders star Leslie Grantham (inset in February), 71, is fighting for his life. The actor, who played 'Dirty' Den Watts (shown left in 1984 and right in 1986) on the BBC soap, is 'very poorly', his representative has said. Grantham has returned to the UK from Bulgaria, where he has been living for a number of years to be under the care of doctors. The legendary actor has received secret visits from his close showbiz pals, with one friend telling the publication: 'Leslie is being looked after. Those who are close to him are hugely worried and are praying for his well-being.' Leslie played the Queen Vic landlord 'Dirty' Den Watts from 1985 to 1989. He helped the soap pull in its biggest ever audience, when 30 million viewers tuned in to see him hand over divorce papers to lying wife Angie on Christmas Day 1986 (right).

item.title: David and Victoria Beckham split rumours: Star looks effortlessly chic in an all-black ensemble for dinner in Mayfair... after dismissing divorce claims
item.description: The former Spice Girl, 44, continued to put the drama behind her as she stepped out for dinner at Mayfair's upscale Scott's Restaurant on Monday evening.
item.content:encoded:
She firmly denied reports of a split with her husband David Beckham, as the pair branded the rumours 'a crock of s**t.'

And Victoria Beckham continued to put the drama behind her as she stepped out for dinner at Mayfair's upscale Scott's Restaurant on Monday evening.

The former Spice Girl, 44, exuded elegance as she strolled the streets of London in a sophisticated black blazer, tied in with a belt which cinched at her waist. 

Further accentuating her slender frame, the high-end designer slipped into a pair of form-fitting trousers, teamed with suede boots.

The mother-of-four injected hints of her trademark glamour into the look as she toted a chic handbag and accessorised with a pair of oversized half-tinted sunglasses and her flashy wedding ring.

Maintaining her trendy display, the Not Such an Innocent Girl hitmaker styled her tresses into loose waves and opted for light strokes of foundation with a nude lipgloss.

Victoria's display comes after her husband David, 43, stepped out solo on Monday morning to attend the NEWGEN LFWM June 2018 breakfast during London Fashion Week Men's.

The father-of-four turned heads at the showcase, held at the BFC Designer Showrooms.

David embraced a casual look for his outing, donning a Union Jack embellished jumper and a pair of beige chinos.

He sported some fashionable Clarks Originals Wallabee suede shoes and showed off a hint of his extensive tattoo collection in his attire. 

Following their loved-up display the previous day, the football star opted to go solo without the support of his devoted wife.

The event was held to celebrate some of the brightest stars in the industry, our NEWGEN designers – A-COLD WALL*, Charles Jeffrey Loverboy, Kiko Kostadinov, Liam Hodges, Per Götesson, Phoebe English, Wales Bonner, Bianca Saunders and paria /FARZANEH.

David was recently appointed the new Ambassadorial President of the British Fashion Council.

The role is designed to raise the profile of emerging British fashion talent on the global stage and help the BFC engage young talent from all backgrounds, into the fashion industry.

The previous day, singer-turned-designer Victoria flooded her Instagram page with snaps from the Kent & Curwen Men's London Fashion Week show, which had also been attended by David.

The couple had arrived at the London event separately and sat apart, before Victoria was spotted reaching over the table to give David's hand a squeeze.

David made a low-key entrance at the event after returning from a trip to the States amid the flurry of divorce rumours, before Victoria was pictured making her arrival a short time later.

The couple, who have been married 19 years, later took their seats inside the show, but with Vogue Editor Edward Enninful sat between them.

They did put on a united front however, with David pictured smiling at his wife as she leaned over their mutual friend to touch his hand.

Victoria was dressed in a flowing white midi dress for the couple's first public outing together since the Royal Wedding on May 19, adding a pop of colour with her yellow heels.

After rumours of an impending split began racing around social media on Friday, Jo Milloy, a spokesman for Spice Girl-turned-designer Victoria, told the Daily Mail that the gossip was ‘absolute nonsense’.

Meanwhile former England football captain’s spokesman, Simon Oliveira, likewise dubbed the claims ‘embarrassing and laughable’.

Elsewhere, a spokesman for the couple was quoted as saying: ‘There is no statement due, no divorce, and a lot of Chinese whispers and fake social media news. This is all very bizarre and an embarrassing waste of time.’ The rumours were ‘a crock of s***’, he said.
item.dc:abstract: She firmly denied reports of a split with her husband David Beckham, as the pair branded the rumours 'a crock of s**t.' And Victoria Beckham continued to put the drama behind her as she stepped out for dinner at Mayfair's upscale Scott's Restaurant on Monday evening. The former Spice Girl, 44, exuded elegance as she strolled the streets of London in a sophisticated blazer, tied in with a belt which cinched at her waist.

item.title: Love Island's Georgia Steel dated millionaire UKIP donor Paul Sykes' grandson Will before 'dumping him to find fame'
item.description: The York student, 20, has had her previous relationship with a UKIP donor's grandson exposed amid claims she dumped him to 'find fame in London'.
item.content:encoded:
She's currently coupled up with Niall Aslam following a cosy date and several smooches.  

And Love Island star Georgia Steel has had her previous relationship with a UKIP donor's grandson exposed amid claims she dumped him to 'find fame in London'. 

The York student, 20, reportedly had a three-year relationship with Will Sykes, who is the grandson of millionaire businessman and prominent UKIP supporter Paul Sykes, but broke off the romance to attend drama school in London.

According to The Sun, Will's grandfather was UKIP's principle European elections donor, and said to be worth upwards of £650million. 

Georgia attended drama school before applying to enter the Love Island villa, and has already caused quite a stir after she celebrated Kendall-Rae Knight's eviction on Friday. 

A source told the publication that the blonde beauty dated Will for a few years but decided to dump him to attend drama school in the pursuit of fame.  

The insider explained: 'She has wanted to be famous for a long time and is considered to be fame hungry by those who know her.

'Nothing would stop her from following her dream – not even her boyfriend. She can be quite ruthless.'

The revelation comes after Georgia revealed she doesn't know if she'll have sex while on the show, which is famous for its risque scenes and on-air romps.

Georgia said: 'To be honest with you I’ve not gone in there yet, so I wouldn’t know how to answer that question.

'I think it can be really difficult for people to make judgments on that question as well without actually being through the experience themselves.'

Despite the somewhat-crude nature of the show, Georgia admitted her family won't be worried if she does have sex on screen. 

'My family accept me for who I am' Georgia continued. 'I’m not ruling out anything and I’m not not saying anything would happen, but I feel like because you’re in there with somebody one-on-one for such a long time and you do really have a connection, you just don’t know.' 

Before entering the famous residence, Georgia said she doesn't have time for pettiness: ‘I’m very confident, the way I am is I’m very very real and my outlook on life is you either like me or you don’t. If you don’t like me, you know where the door is, because I don’t have time for that.

'My intention would never ever be to upset anybody or hurt anybody, the way that I’ve been brought up in life is to be very very honest and sometimes, [for] people who haven’t been around honesty, it can upset them - because sometimes the truth does hurt doesn’t it?'

item.title: Serena Williams puts on a feisty display as she poses up a storm with Black Panther at Disneyland Paris
item.description: The tennis ace, 36, got up-close-and-personal to the superhero himself as she posed alongside the comic book protagonist at the launch of Marvel's Summer of Super Heroes at Disneyland Paris
item.content:encoded:
She helped put together a screening of the Marvel flick Black Panther for tech-based youth group Black Girls CODE in February.

And Serena Williams got up-close-and-personal to the superhero himself as she posed alongside the comic book protagonist at the launch of Marvel's Summer of Super Heroes at Disneyland Paris on Thursday. 

The tennis icon, 36, showed off her feisty side away from the court as she donned her own all-black ensemble and struck a number of signature poses alongside the costumed character.

Serena looked every inch the superhero as she confidently matched the Black Panther poses, including an energetic high kick and a low crouch. 

The tennis ace teamed her black blouse and leggings with box-fresh monochrome sneakers.

Serena left any accessories at home but did inject a pop of vibrant colour with an electric pink manicure.  

The 23-time Grand Slam champ swept her raven tresses up into an elaborate braid that cascaded far past her shoulders as she rocked a fresh-face glow with minimal make-up. 

Serena is no stranger to talking about how the release of Black Panther has inspired her since its US release in February.

When asked about her black bodysuit after beating Kristyna Pliskova at the French Open last month, she said: 'I call it, like, my Wakanda-inspired catsuit,' referring to the fictional nation in the film.

'We designed it way before the movie,' she said, 'but still, it kind of reminds me of that.'

Serena revealed she felt 'like a warrior princess, kind of,' when she wore the outfit on the court.

'I'm always living in a fantasy world,' she added. 'I always wanted to be a superhero, and it's kind of my way of being a superhero.'

Serena - who is married to Reddit founder Alexis Ohanian - also put on a special screening of the hugely successful flick for youth group Black Girls CODE in San Francisco.

Addressing the crowd, Serena enthused: 'I'm glad you guys could make it out. Obviously this is a huge moment for us and for, you know, black people.

'We've never had a superhero movie, so we're so excited. I feel like I've waited my whole life for this.' 

Meanwhile, the tennis pro, who is currently injured and recently pulled out of the French open, cheered herself up at the happiest place on Earth and brought along her internet mogul beau and their daughter Alexis Olympia Jr.

'Do you know where we're going lil' mama?' the new mother - who boasts 24.5M social media followers - asked onInsta-story. 

'We are at Disneyland Paris!' squealed Serena

The four-time Olympic gold medalist and her nine-month-old precious princess were also joined by her mother Oracene Price at the theme park (formerly known as Euro Disney) in Marne-la-Vallée.

While having a family meal, Serena crowned little Olympia with her first-ever $25 sequinned Minnie Mouse Ears headband. 

Williams asked her mini-me: 'Who's that pretty baby with the Mickey Mouse ears?'

The family outing comes after the Being Serena star reveled her plan on eventually getting her adorable daughter - who already boasts 376K Instagram followers - a French tutor, a Mandarin tutor, and a ballet instructor. 

 

'If I wasn't playing tennis, I'd be pregnant right now. Sorry, I'm one of those women,' the Michigan-born champ told Harper's Bazaar UK last week.

'I told Alexis, I hope [our second child] is another girl. Olympia needs a little sister, and then we can have a boy. I've only been around girls my whole life...It's definitely family before tennis for me. When I'm training, I have to be done at 1pm, because I've got to be with Olympia. I haven't gone a day without seeing her.'

Serena looked genuinely happy after having undergone an MRI on the pectoral muscle she injured Saturday, which forced her to entirely pull out of the French Open.
item.dc:abstract: She helped put together a screening of the Marvel flick Black Panther for tech-based youth group Black Girls CODE in February. And Serena Williams got up-close-and-personal to the superhero himself as she posed alongside the comic book protagonist at the launch of Marvel's Summer of Super Heroes at Disneyland Paris on Thursday. The tennis icon, 36, showed off her feisty side away from the court as she donned her own all-black ensemble and struck a number of signature poses alongside the costumed character.

item.title: Debra Messing, 49, reveals she had to wear 'fake breasts' in early days of her career after a male TV president insisted
item.description: Debra Messing was forced to wear fake breasts in the beginning of the career when she starred on shows like Ned And Stacey. That's what the Will & Grace actress told Sharon Stone.
item.content:encoded:
Debra Messing was forced to wear fake breasts in the beginning of the career when she starred on shows like Ned And Stacey.

That's what the Will & Grace actress told Sharon Stone during an Actors On Actors session for Variety this weekend.

'I had to wear fake boobs when I first started in Hollywood on my first sitcom,' Messing revealed.

Producers handed her cutlets to enhance her breast size.

And when she first saw them she didn't really know what they were. But she put them on. 

She told the producers she looked 'stupid,' adding, 'I'm not going to wear these.'

They said back, 'The president of the network called and said he wants you to wear those.'

Debra then said: 'I was in shock. I was new to the industry and I just thought, "I can't say no," you know. Now, no one comes at me with those things. I'm like, "I'm flat-chested, I love it."'

The NYU graduate did not say what show it was for.

Her first few shows were NYPD Blue in 1994, Partners in 1995, McHale's Navy in 1997, Seinfeld in 1997, Ned And Stacey in 1995 until 1997 and Prey in 1998.

In Ned And Stacey the redhead looked to have a much larger chest.

The Emmy Award-winning Actors On Actors series will air in two episodes on PBS SoCal KOCE, June 19 and June 21. 

This comes after she hosted an FYC event with Megan Mullally, Eric McCormack and Sean Hayes in Los Angeles.

The actress looked sexy in a camera-confusing black and white striped dress, divided into quadrants of parallel and zig-zag lines.

She paired it with classic nude heels, and left her voluminous signature deep red locks loose. 

Her title-sharing partner McCormack, who plays the other half of the BFF pairing, looked his usual handsome self in a grey checked blazer and navy slacks, white button-up and tan shoes. 

Mullally, who plays the shrill Karen, wore a magnificently colored dress of greens, blues, reds, yellows and black.

Hayes, who plays the clown of the quartet Jack, paired a navy blazer with a lilac shirt. 

The foursome were joined at the event by the show's creators David Kohan and Max Mutchnick.

Mutchnick and his childhood best friend Janet Eisenberg were the inspiration for Will and Grace back when the comedy was first dreamt up.

Will & Grace originally ran for eight season, from September 1998 to May 2006.

Amid a flurry of reboots, prequels, sequels and re-imaginings, the show was brought back to life by NBC in September 2017.

A year before the four were brought together for a ten-minute special urging Americans to vote in the 2016 election.

While that may not have gone the way they wanted, the success of the short prompted the network to explore a full revival ninth season.

It was then re-renewed for a tenth and eleventh season, still to come.

item.title: Claire Foy dazzles in royal blue at The Girl in the Spider's Web screening... amid criticism for being 'too prim' to play Lisbeth
item.description: Claire Foy, 34, looked happy as ever as she attended the film's photocall in Barcelona on Sunday, in a stunning royal blue dress with an asymmetric hem.
item.content:encoded:
She's received criticism after taking the role of Lisbeth in The Girl in the Spider's Web.

But Claire Foy, 34, looked happy as ever as she attended the film's photocall in Barcelona on Sunday, in a stunning royal blue dress with an asymmetric hem.

The Golden Globe award winning actress stunned in the statement ensemble, and added a pair of lace up scarlet heeled stilettos to boost her height.

Claire's cropped chocolate locks framed her face as she smiled for the camera, and she opted for a eye catching burgundy lip to add a pop of colour.

The Crown star posed for pictures with co-stars Sverrir Gudnason and Sylvia Hoeks during the event, with Sylvia wearing a geometric jumpsuit to show off her slender figure.

Film fans have been complaining on social media that the 34-year-old actress is 'too prim' and 'sounds way too proper' to play a hacker with violent tendencies.

Many insisted Rooney Mara, who starred in The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo with Daniel Craig, should have remained in the role.

'Honestly, I think Claire Foy is all wrong for this. She looks too prim for Lisbeth and sounds way too proper. It's like an impression of Rooney Mara without the abrasiveness,' said one critic.

'Too early to judge but based on this 1st look they should've stuck with Fincher & Mara,' added another. 'Still can’t believe they did this to Rooney Mara,' said a third.

Claire takes on the role of Lisbeth from Rooney Mara - with the flick a follow-on from The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo, based on the novel by Stieg Larsson.

However, the new installment follows the fourth book, written by David Lagercrantz after author's death in 2004.

Columbia Pictures decided to skip the story forward last year as David Fincher, the director of the first film, struggled to get books two and three onto the big screen.

This installment is directed by Uruguayan filmmaker Fede Álvarez, while Swedish actor Sverrir Gudnason replaces Daniel Craig as the lead male protagonist, Mikael Blomkvist.

Other notable cast members include Get Out star Lakeith Stanfield, 26, and Stephen Merchant, 43.

Speaking at CinemaCon in April, Claire admitted it was both daunting but exciting to take on the famous role, loved by fans of the Millennium trilogy worldwide.

She said of the avenger: 'The character of Lisbeth is truly iconic… she’s very much a survivor.'

item.title: Willow Smith says she walked in on her parents having sex... before mom Jada reveals her own grandmother taught her about masturbation at NINE
item.description: It seems no topic is off limits in the Smith household.
item.content:encoded:
It seems no topic is off limits in the Smith household.

Will and Jada Smith's daughter Willow - who had a pop hit with Whip My Hair - joined her mother and grandmother for a sex-themed episode of her mom's Facebook show on Monday.

And the trio talked about everything from Willow's first sexual experience - walking in on her famous parents - to Jada learning to masturbate, when she was 'taught about self-pleasure' by her grandmother at nine. 

'My introduction to sex was obviously walking in on you and Daddy,' Willow, 17, explained. 

Scroll down for video 

Acting shocked, Jada asked for more info. 'When the hell did you walk in on us?' said the 46-year-old, married to actor Will. 

Willow recalled: 'It was in Utah… not Utah. Aspen. I was going downstairs to get some juice and I saw for a little moment and I ran away. I was like, "Oh my God, this is so crazy. What did I just see?"'

Jada was shocked but laughed, ramrking: 'I don't remember this.'

Luckily, the room was dark. 'It was silhouetted,' she added. 

Jada then moved the conversation onto her own experience of learning about sexuality, saying she was just nine-years-old when she learnt about self-pleasure. 

'My grandmother taught me about self-pleasuring because she wanted me to know that pleasure was from me. She didn't wnat me to fall into the hands of a man and if he gave me pleasure to think that pelasure came from him. And she taught me at nine. At nine.' 

Jada also revealed she knew the moment her son Jaden, and step-son Trey, lost their virginities. 

'I knew the night, the night, Jaden lost his virginity,' said Jada.

'And I had a moment with Trey, in the kitchen, where I looked at him like 'You've had sex.'

Embarrassed by his stepmother, Trey ran into the bathroom. 

Said Jada: 'He was just like, "Fine yes, I've had sex." He was embarrassed.  It was like their innocence was gone.'

Jada also talked about her youthful obsession with sex toys, saying she gave herself up to five orgasms a day at one stage. 

'I think by your age, I gave myself multiples, first,' Jada told Willow's 21-year-old best friend Telana. 

'Multiple orgasms. I was really into it at one point. Just because I was in an exploration state and I was abstaining from men. 

'And I actually think I went through kind of an addiction too with it. And then one day, I was like, "Enough. You’re having five orgasms a day."'

But despite her youthful obsession with orgasms, Jada said she doesn't think relationships are all about sex.

'I'll say that great sex is necessary for a great relationship for me. 

'Especially after being in a union for as long as I have been. It gets deep.'

Jada has been married to actor Will for 20 years.

item.title: Love Island's Alex Beattie insists pal Adam Collard is 'playing a game' in the villa and is 'using the show as a platform' for his fitness career
item.description: The Love Island star, 23, has weighed in on the latest edition of the show, as he revealed his close pal Adam Collard is 'playing a game' during his time on the ITV favourite in an interview with The Sun.
item.content:encoded:
They quickly struck up a friendship after meeting at their local gym in 2016.

And Alex Beattie has weighed in on the latest edition of the show, as he revealed his close pal Adam Collard is 'playing a game' during his time on the ITV favourite in an interview with The Sun.

The Love Island star, 23 - who appeared series 3 of the show - also claimed the 22-year-old Geordie and his fellow hopefuls are using the platform as an 'opportunity to boost their careers', insisting that the hunk 'wants to do more with his gym and fitness things'.   

Sharing his friend's true intentions, Alex said: 'He's in the villa to do exactly what everyone else is in there to do, to stay in the game.'

According to the personal trainer, Adam - who has founded his exercise programme Sculpt Fitness - is hoping his business booms with help from publicity on the show.

'Adam wants to do more with his gym and fitness things. It's an opportunity for everyone to find somebody and also an opportunity to boost or start your career', he said.

Alex went on to discuss his thoughts on Adam's former and current love interests Kendall-Rae Knight and Rosie Williams, claiming that the 26-year-olds bear a striking resemblance to his ex-girlfriend.

He added: 'His ex-girlfriend is a blend between Rosie's looks and Kendall's personality.' 

Meanwhile, the muscular star sent fans wild as he chose to save Rosie over Kendall in the show's first eviction on Friday's edition.

The pair have not been afraid to showcase their passion for each other, as they have shared a number of passionate smooches during their short-time in the villa.

The sexual chemistry between Rosie and Adam continued to heat up in the villa on Sunday evening, as the duo got acquainted with their new coupling. 

The couples woke up to a hot yoga session the morning after the recoupling, which forced them into some particularly compromising positions, including the 'double downward dog'.

However, it was much to the delight of new girl Rosie, who said in the Beach Hut afterwards: 'It was a good chance to get closer to [Adam] - we did positions we probably never thought we'd be doing.'

item.title: Kelly Dodd breaks down in TEARS as she fights with Vicki Gunvalson in tense trailer for RHOC season 13
item.description: Tension run high in the season 13 trailer for The Real Housewives Of Orange County. Kelly Dodd, in the midst of her split from her husband Michael, quips about the experience.
item.content:encoded:
Tension run high in the season 13 trailer for The Real Housewives Of Orange County.

Kelly Dodd, in the midst of her split from her husband Michael, vamps: 'You know why divorce is so expensive? Because it's worth it.'

But the 42-year-old's brave face melts into tears on the Bravo show, when her fellow Housewife Vicki Gunvalson reveals that she and her beau Steve Lodge 'went on a double date with [Kelly's] ex-husband.'

Scroll down for video 

'Obviously, you're not my friend,' Kelly says, sobbing, only for her close pal Vicki to insist: 'I didn't betray you!'

Vicki and Steve can be seen working through a couple of rocky moments in their relationship when the prospect of marriage comes up.

Though Vicki assures him: 'I'm not asking you to marry me,' Tamra Judge tells him something rather to the contrary.

As Tamra, Vicki and Steve sit together over drinks, Tamra slams the table and demands of him: 'You need to marry Vicki, right now!'

Steve tells the women to 'Talk among yourselves' and exits, leaving a mortified Vicki burying her face in her hands at the table.

In a more playful moment, she appears to share a smooch on the lips with another fellow Housewife, sombrero-wearing Shannon Beador.

Shannon, like Kelly, is recovering from the collapse of a marriage, and the trailer offers a glimpse at her attempts to get back in the dating game.

She has to be encouraged to take off her wedding ring, and shares how 'nervous' she is 'to walk into a blind date.'

Shortly thereafter, she is filmed on a date and appears to be having a lovely time, smiling cheerfully with the man across the table.

Shannon nevertheless assures viewers in a confessional, gesturing at her figure: 'I need to get to know somebody before you get to know this.'

Tamra's personal travails are also put on display - namely, that her hunky husband Eddie underwent four heart surgeries in as many months recently.

'I just keep thinking about the mortality rate,' she says during a weepy conversation with her mother. 'I'm scared for my husband.'

Viewers get a glimpse of a 'home video' Tamra shot, apparently on her cellphone, of her husband lying unconscious in his hospital bed.

Shannon and Tamra's nerves are visibly frayed near the end of the trailer, when they wind up in snapping viciously at each other.

'Don't even f***ing blame it on me, Shannon Beador!' Tamra rages across an alfresco table as several Real Housewives gape at them over their place settings.

In another shouting match, Shannon rages at Kelly Dodd, with Tamra looking on: 'So, you're gonna do a godd*** f***ing straitjacket intervention right now?'

Tamra eventually shrieks: 'Stop screaming for one f***ing time in your life, and listen!'

All of this stress manages to build up in spite of the fact that, over the course of this season, the Housewives take a luxurious holiday to sun-drenched Jamaica.

The reality TV stars are seen traipsing over a waterfall, as well as toasting each other as they overlook the ocean at sunset.

Season 13 of The Real Housewives Of Orange County will bow June 19 at 9/8c on Bravo.
item.dc:abstract: Tension run high in the season 13 trailer for The Real Housewives Of Orange County. Kelly Dodd, in the midst of her split from her husband Michael, vamps: 'You know why divorce is so expensive? Because it's worth it.' But the 42-year-old's brave face melts into tears on the Bravo show, when her fellow Housewife Vicki Gunvalson reveals that she and her beau Steve Lodge 'went on a double date with [Kelly's] ex-husband.'
item.dc:creator: Heidi Parker
item.mi:shortTitle: Kelly Dodd tearfully fights with Vicki Gunvalson in RHOC season 13

item.title: Lisa Lampanelli, 56, blows up on stage after fan in audience hands her $100 to 'shut the f*** up'
item.description: Comedian Lisa Lampanelli went off at her show in San Jose, California Sunday after offering an upset fan his money back for his ticket. The guy handed her the money back to 'shut the f**k up.'
item.content:encoded:
Comedian Lisa Lampanelli, 56, wasn't too happy when tables turned and she found herself getting insulted.

The 56-year-old funny lady was told to 'shut the f*** up' and even offered her $100 bill to do so by an audience member at her show in San Jose, California on Sunday. 

People who were at the comedy show at San Jose City National Civic center are saying that after she was insulted by the onlooker, the queen of mean went postal on the crew manning the lights. 

Scroll down for video 

She went on an even bigger tirade after someone from the balcony called her a 'c***.'

Lisa eventually left the stage 30 minutes into what was supposed to be an hour-plus long set and never came back.

'Get the f*** out,' she screamed at the original man she was arguing with.

'If you're going to f***ing talk s*** to me at my own show, mother f***er, I will give you personally your money back because I don't need to work for people,' she said.

She called him stupid, a 'f***ing idiot' and said she'd tear up his $100, before turning to yell at the lighting crew who may have been trying to diffuse the attention. 

'First of all, did I f***ing tell you to leave those f***ing lights on. I said it and I f***ing mean it you f***ing moron. Anyone who thinks I need any f***ing help needs to shut the f*** up. Anyone of you.' 

At one point on the video she is heard saying, 'I'm just saying be quiet Stevie Nicks retarded cousin.'

Fans seemed concerned for the comedienne who walked off stage early, and they tweeted their well wishes. Others were upset that she lost her cool and left early.

The next day, Lampanelli dished about the incident to TMZ, explaining that she had been doing crowd work when a man at the other side of the audience 'yelled something to get my attention and totally interrupted the flow with the person I was talking to - which I hate, because that person paid too.'

She quipped: 'I hit menopause and also I hit 56 years old and I said: "Really, I gotta pull up - I gotta put up with some guy yelling at me?"

Lampanelli added that 'I never went with the sexist thing, but I gotta tell you, nowadays more and more people are telling women to shut up. So, guess who has to be a bigger mouth than ever is Lisa Lampanelli, 'cause nobody ever tried to do nothing to me to shut me up till now, and it ain't gonna work.'

The New Jersey-born comic vamped: 'If this does happen again, please someone tape it when I'm acting intelligent, because I honestly do know more words than the f-word. I'll throw in the c-word, if you like.'

She summed up the experience: 'I'm an insult comic, everybody was having fun, and honestly, if you want me to be 100% serious, when one guy does that, the other people who paid money really don't have the same enjoyment.

'So I figured I would cut out the cancer, and unfortunately the cancer kept growing in the form of this large man who nobody kicked out. So it was fine.'

As she noted: 'I liked that video, though, 'cause I looked really skinny. So everybody - that's what really counts. I'm a skinny b****.'

Lampanelli has been on tour, without incident, in Seattle and Anaheim this weekend, and reception to her tour has been overwhelmingly positive.  

The insult comic known for her success on Celebrity Apprentice lost a whopping 107 pounds in 2012 after undergoing gastric sleeve surgery. She has since kept the weight off.
item.dc:abstract: Comedian Lisa Lampanelli went off at her show in San Jose, California Sunday after offering an upset fan his money back for his ticket. Instead of taking the cash, the guy handed her the money back to 'shut the f**k up.'
item.dc:creator: Heidi Parker
item.mi:shortTitle: Lisa Lampanelli has meltdown after fan hands her money to shut up
